meta.title: Home - Washingtonville Central School District

meta.name: format-detection

li.a: Teacher Center Policies and Policy Board Meetings

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsSlideshow fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailXLarge fsItemCount_10 fsSlideshowHorizontal

div.p: An important update for our community.
Please join us for a memorial procession to honor our brother and friend. Sunday, April 26th 1pm-4pm. More information enclosed.
Washingtonville High School Remote Learning Plan and Grading Policy
We have been informed that a member of our school staff has been tested positive for COVID-19. We know that more confirmed cases have developed and will continue to develop in our community.
An IMPORTANT Update from the Superintendent.

header.h2: Welcome to Washingtonville Central School District

div.p: Washingtonville is nestled in the iconic Hudson Valley, just west of the Hudson River and 60 miles north of New York City. It is the home of the Brotherhood Winery and only 20 minutes from West Point and Woodbury Commons. Our residents are passionate about their schools, which shows in the support they give each year to our academic, athletic, and arts programs.

Washingtonville offers Pre-K through Grade 12, serves a population of over 4,500 students, and is composed of three elementary schools, one middle school, and one high school. The District is among the highest graduation rates in Orange County at 93 percent, 13 percentage points above the New York State average.

div.a: RESCHEDULED Board of Education Business Meeting

div.div:
Washingtonville Central School District 52 West Main Street
Washingtonville, NY 10992
P: 845.497.4000
F: 845.497.4030
Child Abuse Hotline: 1.800.342.3720
NYS Child & Family Services

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

p.strong: SCHOOL CLOSURE UPDATE: Governor Cuomo recently announced the extension of "New York State on PAUSE" executive order, which includes the closure of all PreK-12 schools in New York State. Per his order, the Washingtonville School District will now be closed through Friday, May 15th at which time the Governor will reassess and determine if a longer closure is necessary.

div.p: Please visit our dedicated COVID-19 Awareness Webpage for additional resources and our Online Learning Hub., continue to sign in to Google Classrooms, and contact your teachers and principals for learning activities. We will continue to update you via robocall as well as on our website and social media pages.

p.b: This is a friendly reminder that given the current pandemic related to COVID-19, no use of our District’s facilities is permitted until further notice. By taking these actions together, we can ensure the health and safety of all members of the Washingtonville Community. Thank you for your understanding during this difficult time.

div.p: Should you need immediate assistance, please contact the Orange County Crisis Call Center (available 24/7) at 1-800-832-1200.

As you know, Governor Cuomo directed all schools in New York State to close for two weeks, beginning March 16. One of our priorities as a school community is to ensure our parents/guardians, who are either first responders or health care providers, have the necessary child care supports in place to continue working outside of the home during this extended school closure. We want to hear from you. If you are a first responder or health care provider who requires child care support during Washingtonville’s current extended school closure, please take a few minutes to complete the survey below so the District can plan ways to assist you. Thank you for all your hard work as you strive to keep us safe during this health crisis.
